DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess an innovative Visual Analogue Scale of pain (pictorial VAS) versus the usual VAS (VAS) among Deaf People. The assumption of this study is that pictorial VAS is more suited to Deaf people than usual VAS.
DOC.brief_title: Multicenter Trial Assessing an Innovative VAS of Pain Among Deaf People
DOC.detailed_description: Indeed French literature showed that 80% of Deaf people are illiterate. Moreover, lip-reading only allows to recognize one third of words. Pictorial VAS includes elements which promote understanding of Deaf people: colours and 6 detailed expressive faces.
DOC.criteria: people aged over 18 years old Deaf people affiliation to the french social security system or equivalent people who signed the consent form hearing people people who became deaf pregnant or breastfeeding women people deprived of freedom people hospitalized without consent
